p1:
Young talent is something we are very passionate about. At the Design Office we hire people, not skills. Even if you’re not a designer but you’ve finished your studies and have interest in solving wicked problems, we’d love for you to grow your skills with us. 

The year will focus on allowing you to explore different areas of design and business to see what interests you most and where your strengths lie. This is a paid programme that runs over 12 months and will provide you with training, mentorship and tons of fun throughout the year.

steps.title: What’s next?
steps.text: We’ll have a look at it and let you know what’s next.

steps.title: Challenge
steps.text: You’ll come in so we can get to know you a bit better and we’ll give you a challenge to complete on the day in order to see where your strengths lie.

steps.title: Results
steps.text: We’ll get back to you again to let you know if you’ve been accepted into the programme or not.

steps.title: Introduction
steps.text: Once onboard we’ll introduce you to the office and get you settled into the ADO culture.

steps.title: Exploration
steps.text: You’ll get to explore CX, UX, UI and PE (don’t stress if you dont know what these things are yet).

steps.title: The grind
steps.text: You’ll work on some wicked problems in sets of three month rotations to find out what interests you most.

steps.title: Hope
steps.text: And finally, fingers crossed, you might get permenantly placed.

p3: Here are some of the ways we work. We are a designed focused team that heavily relies on design thinking.

workTypes.title: Customer Experience
workTypes.content: An interaction between an organization and a customer over the duration of their relationship.

workTypes.title: User experience
workTypes.content: Enhancing user satisfaction with a product by improving the usability and accessibility, provided in the interaction with the product.

workTypes.title: User-Interface
workTypes.content: Design of user interfaces for computers, mobile devices, with the focus on maximizing usability and the user experience.

workTypes.title: Prototyping
workTypes.content: A basic version of the system is built, tested, and then reworked until an acceptable prototype is finally achieved.
